name: Tuna Salad
description: Light and nutritious classic tuna salad, packed with protein. Perfect for lunch or sandwiches.

instructions.instruction: Open tuna cans and drain liquid thoroughly. Transfer to a bowl.
instructions.tip: Choose tuna in water - less calories than oil-packed.

instructions.instruction: Break up tuna with fork into rough chunks. Don't mash completely - some texture is nice.
instructions.tip: Larger pieces give the salad character.

instructions.instruction: Finely chop celery stalks. Add to tuna bowl.
Finely dice red onion. To reduce sharpness, soak in cold water for 5 minutes, then drain.
Dice pickles into small cubes. Add to tuna mixture.
instructions.tip: Pickles are the secret hero - add sweet-sour balance.

instructions.instruction: In a separate small bowl, mix dressing: mayonnaise, yogurt, mustard, and lemon juice.
instructions.tip: Adding yogurt reduces mayo and makes it lighter.

instructions.instruction: Add dressing to tuna mixture. Gently fold with spatula or spoon.
instructions.tip: Don't over-mix - keep tuna chunks intact.

instructions.instruction: Add salt and pepper, stir to combine.
Add capers if using - they add Mediterranean flavor.
Add chopped dill and give final stir.
Taste and adjust lemon or salt as needed.
Serve immediately or refrigerate 30 minutes for flavors to meld.

tips: Tuna is high-quality protein and omega-3 source.
For healthier version, replace all mayo with yogurt.
Ideal for meal prep - keeps 3 days refrigerated.
Choose sustainably caught tuna when possible.
storageInfo: Refrigerate in airtight container for 3 days.
servingSuggestion: Serve on whole wheat bread, in lettuce wraps, or on crackers.
variations: Avocado: Add mashed avocado, reduce mayo.
Mediterranean: Add olives, sun-dried tomatoes, and feta.
Asian style: Add soy sauce, sesame oil, and green onion.
Apple walnut: Add diced apple and chopped walnuts.
